DOC.brief_summary: This pilot clinical trial study target biopsy determine response patient prostate cancer undergo high-dose-rate brachytherapy ( type radiation therapy radioactive material seal needle , seed , wire , catheter place directly near tumor ) . Studying tumor tissue obtain treatment may help doctor understand change pathway look deoxyribonucleic acid ( DNA ) repair damage see difference prostate tissue prior start androgen deprivation therapy .
DOC.brief_title: Targeted Biopsies Determining Response Patients With Prostate Cancer Undergoing High-Dose-Rate Brachytherapy
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Demonstrate feasibility obtain adequate tumor tissue intra-prostatic index lesion prior start androgen deprivation therapy ( ADT ) time high-dose-rate ( HDR ) brachytherapy . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . Use immunohistochemistry stain cell pre-ADT post 2 month ADT marker non-homologous end join DNA double strand break use follow marker : Ku70 , Ku80 , DNA-dependent protein kinase catalytic subunit ( PKCs ) , gamma-histone family , member X ( H2AX ) . OUTLINE : Patients undergo biopsy baseline start ADT brachytherapy .
DOC.criteria: Histologically confirm primary adenocarcinoma prostate National Comprehensive Cancer Network ( NCCN ) high risk disease ( cT3 Gleason score 810 prostate specific antigen [ PSA ] > 20 ) Not currently ADT Magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) transrectal doppler ultrasound demonstrate least one target lesion Karnofsky performance status ( KPS ) > = 70 Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group ( ECOG ) = 2 Understands trial procedure willing able sign inform consent form Patient unable receive high dose rate prostate brachytherapy Patient unable MRI transrectal ultrasound Refusal sign inform consent Patients participate concurrent treatment protocol
